intro: Chaetostoma flavum, commonly known as the golden tailed pleco, is a type of freshwater catfish native to South America. It is characterized by its elongated body and distinctive golden-yellow coloration along the dorsal and caudal regions. The species belongs to the family Loricariidae, which includes many armored catfish species. It has a unique appearance with a row of small, protruding spines along its back. This fish is often kept in aquariums due to its hardy nature and interesting behavior.
